abstract: A new analysis supports other work showing a big climate benefit from choosing gas over coal for electricity generation.
snippet: A new analysis supports other work showing a big climate benefit from choosing gas over coal for electricity generation.
lead_paragraph: The Worldwatch Institute and Deutsche Bank Climate Change Advisors recently analyzed the full greenhouse impacts of natural gas and coal -- from the well or mine to the power plant -- and the work supports other studies pointing to a large and clear climate advantage from gas as a source of electricity. Here's a news release and a pdf of the study.

headline.main: More Evidence of a Big Greenhouse Advantage from Gas Over Coal
